definition[0]: the price of something on a market at a particular time
example[0]: The price of A$6.75 for the new shares compares with Thursdayâ€™s closing market price of A$7.88.
definition[1]: used to talk about the real price or cost of something that a market decides, rather than one calculated or fixed, for example by a government
example[1]: OPEC self-interest will ensure us of oil at market prices.
definition[2]: the price of something calculated in relation to what buyers are willing to pay at a particular time, rather than in some other way
example[2]: measures forcing banks to value assets at market prices, rather than at their original cost
